summary: Comprehensive testing of HI AI-APP.COM new features: Splash screen, Landing page, Doers Profiler, Family Dashboard, and Captain Command. All 10 features tested successfully. Backend APIs (POST/GET profiles, families) working correctly with MongoDB persistence.
passed_tests: Splash screen loads with ASTRO DOER SVG (141.svg) and 'Loading...' text
Splash transitions to 'RIGHT DOERS WELCOMES YOU' stage with 140.svg
Landing page shows 'WHO ARE YOU?' with 5 entry points (PUPIL, PEOPLE, PROFILES, PARTNERS, PERFORMERS)
PANCHA PANDAVA badge correctly removed from landing page
Clicking PROFILES entry navigates to /dp (Doers Profiler)
/dp page shows Talent Card with DoersScore (847/900), Efficiency Value (86%), Adaptive Level (Professional L4)
Share button opens 'Send Your Profiler' modal with 6 share options (WhatsApp, LinkedIn, X/Twitter, Facebook, Email, Copy)
/family page shows DOERS ONE with Kannada text, Family DoersScore (737), 3 family members
/captain-command shows 5C Framework (CONNECTIONS, CAMPAIGNS, COMMUNICATIONS, CONTENT, CURRENCY) with Neil Patel reference
Backend API POST /api/profiles creates profile with DoersScore (300-900 range), 6 dimensions, skills
Backend API GET /api/profiles/{id} retrieves profile correctly
Backend API POST /api/families creates family with calculated family_doers_score
Backend API GET /api/families/{id} retrieves family correctly
critical_code_review_comments: Share modal Escape key doesn't close modal - clicking outside works but Escape key press doesn't dismiss it properly
6 Dimensions tab content not fully tested due to modal overlay issue - but dimensions are present in page content
seed_data_creation: Used existing seed data from /api/seed endpoint
context_for_next_testing_agent: All new features (Splash, Landing, Doers Profiler, Family Dashboard, Captain Command) are working correctly. Backend APIs for profiles and families are persisting to MongoDB. Share modal has all 6 share options. Family page has Kannada language support. Captain Command shows 5C Framework with Neil Patel reference. SVG assets (140.svg, 141.svg) are loading correctly on splash screen.
